page.title: 15RECREATION
page.content:
Thornton Watlass has a very good cricket team. They do very well in the league. The village green is a very pretty place to play. The wicket is protected by fencing when the game is not being played. They remove the posts to play the game. At the Buck Inn wire netting is put over the windows to protect them. In the Village Hall a small room, the cricket room, acts as the pavillion. There good food and refreshments are provided for the teams by the cricketers' wives.
The cricket team belongs to the Wensleydale League and does very well. Players are drawn from local villages.
Darts and dominoes are played at the Buck Inn but the players do not belong to any league.
